values: Out of curiosity, I want to know WHICH IS YOUR FAVOURITE BAND no big deal, just comment and write the name of your fav. band or artist. I just wanted to know. And I bet 70% is gonna be Marilyn Manson :P I have nearly only mansonites. If you find it hard to name your one favourite band, just list three or five. But not four!!!!! *dies* HIAWATHA!!!

These two are going in my user info. I love them. Thank you my dear beloved Cha <3
Sir Cha is Cha Love
Mr. and Mrs. Cha are pure Cha Love
EDIT: As a special thanks to my dear cha,
Gaaarh! He's insane!!! Che che!!!

HAPPINESS! Is what the world should be embraced by.
I just really felt like saying that. Dunno why. I also feel like doing a friends cut. 47 friends are silly. Only knowing about half of them is even sillier. The word silly is silly. So I will delete friends who don't comment to this entry, and I'll let this entry be public incase they come running back after a month or two not knowing whats happened here. BUT - SOME OF YOU will NOT ESCAPE MY WRATH! Bwuhahahah!!!! You'll have to stay on my friends list whether you like it or not.
I'm sorry but the following of you aren't done with me yet: , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , , I hope I remembered most of you :P sorry if not. Please comment if you're not on this list but want to be. This could also be your chance to get rid of me too if you're not on here. The you should shut up and wait a few days - tada, you're free!!!
And I just joined , my Dear Cha is a mod there. Now I'm in 44 communities... I think I'll leave some of them... But later. I've got a test tomorrow. And I had a math exam today. I hate maths the most. I got hold of a few books on saturday :D mostly psychology and parapsychology books :) I love that stuff. I'm currently reading one called "How to use conversation for profit and pleasure" (Hva folk sier og det de virkelig mener in norwegian) and it's REALLY interesting, I learnt alot from it already. The other one's were called "The Anatomy of Fate", "The Silvia Mind Control Method for Getting Help From Your Other Side", "Teach Yourself to dream", "The Magic Thread" and "You Can Always Win The Conversation". I doubt I'll ever read all of them, but atleast half of them I hope :) psychology is interesting... That was a statement...

Perfect for me. I love mythology. What a coincidense. Or are there such things as coincidenses? Yes, I know I spelt coincidense wrong... I'm definately putting this in my userinfo, when it stops acting all fucked up. It won't let me change it, which annoys me, 'cause I really feel like changing it.

I just got home from work. I have a math exam tomorrow, and haven't studied yet. It's too late to study now. And math is my worst subject. Not the one with worst grades, but the one with least understanding. I hate trying to do something I don't understand, it's so pointless. I have to be able to see some logic in it. I've been that way my whole life. I didn't start speaking norwegian before I was four, but when I did, I spoke it perfectly, as if I had been building it up my whole life, and then one day in kindergarten, I suddenly released it. Ofcourse, I spoke english before that :P when you're four you need some way of communication I really hope the people at work haven't labelled me as a satanist or something like that. I've heard some "jokes" (hopefully jokes) like "are you going home to listen to your satan rock now?" and "it's fun working in the kitchen with a satanist and all his exiting music" I seriously hope they were joking, so they don't ruin my opinion on "grown ups" I thought, well, atleast grown ups aren't stupid enough to judge people after a second. My dad is pretty OK, he never questions me. But my mom.... I think she's just worried. Babble babble about my interesting life...I bet you don't care to read half of this. But please atleast pretend to, it makes me feel better :P "They can crush us, they can kill us, but they can never kill our spirits." I'm really starting to love Rasputina and Jack Off Jill. Excellent music That poll I've been trying to get up for ages never seems to work whatever I do. It's pissing me off. I bet LJ blocked polls so people upgrade to a paid account instead and get polls. Well, that's stupid. I won't pay just to get a poll. Two girls in my class were having a conversation today: - Did you hear there was a nazi parade in town yesterday? - Oh, I bet Thomas and Eirin were there Eirin is my best friend. I think I could say she's a goth. She says she is one herself, and she dresses gothic. She get's all this shit from people too, but she doesn't care, cause she actually is a little in to satan and that stuff. I don't mind it, I think it's wrong ofcourse, but I don't critisize her. I don't think she's that serious. Two other girls (the absolute biggest bimbos in my grade) were talking to me. I had theese strawberry flavoured drops oor whatever you called them, and they were begging me for one. - We have a disease, we're addicted to candy. - Oh, I know what you mean, I have that to, but not with candy. - Well what are you addicted to then? Satan? - Seriously, was that a question? - Yes. - Why the fuck do you ask me about something that stupid? - You seem like you're addicted to satan. I never did anything bad to those girls. I always thought they were bimbos, but I never said anything. Everyone else does :P so I don't have to tell them. Are people being mean to me or are they just being honest? Why does this happen EVERY FUCKING DAY? It doesn't exactly cheer me up. ...should I put this in a cut? *thinking* will people read this if it's in a cut? ah, who gives a fuck, I bet no one else than myself will ever read it.">

Atlast, I found a great page for free webpolls. Now I can have a REAL vote for mansons best album. This one will last til new years eve. I've made sure you can only vote once. Since not very many (maybe 5 or 6) people read my journal, please ask some of your friends who love manson to vote to. I don't really care who votes, as long as they're serious. Just give them a link or something. Thank you people, and vote! Thomas
Don't mind the thingie above, it was just necessary to activate the poll service (or whatever).

I should post...but I don't know what to write... I've finally got my new computer. It's working fine. I also got a job about three weeks ago in a pub/restaurant. I just help out in the kitchen and serve people and stuff, but still, I enjoy it, and now I have an income :) so I can invest in stocks...or buy clothes...:D hard choice. I think this is about 75% true, because it said this too:

 trait snapshot:

clean, organized, dislikes chaos, semi neat freak, perfectionist, traditional, realist, fits in most places, enjoys managing others, risk averse, good at saving money, prudent, respects authority, high self control, hard working, does not like to stand out, follows the rules, finisher, resilient, takes precautions, cautious, honest, unfamiliar with the dark side of life, practical, conforming

And the following things DEFINETLY don't suit me;

  • followes the rules
  • good at saving money
  • unfamiliar with the dark side of life
  • traditional!!!?!!

Some of the things I don't even know the meaning of, like prudent and resilient and risk averse.

But I am NOT traditional. I think. No, I'm not.......

I had this pathetic little idea of mine a little while ago, for all you of my LJ friends to vote for your favourite MM album. Not many votes, some had two votes, anyway, here are the results:
Portrait of an american family - 1 vote Mechanical Animals - 2 votes Antichrist Superstar - 2 votes Holy Wood - 4 votes
 Unexpected (from my side) Holy Wood won, with 4 (pathetic) votes. Well, I haven't listened much to Holy Wood, but what I recall is great. But I still expected ACSS to win. So much for now! Enjoy the rest of your day! Coming in the next episode of Thomas's incredibly exciting life: Part two of Mr.Happy Bunny - The return from his grave

I nearly fell asleep in the norwegian class at school two days ago.

That's when Mr. Happy Bunny cam to this world (to soon leave it, and then again return)

Mr. Happy Bunny

Mr. Happy Bunny
was a very happy animal indeed
he loved to hop around
in a happy funny speed

One day he was tired of hopping
and wanted to take a nap
he surely got a long one
when he hopped into a bear-trap

Mr. Happy Bunny is stolen from Roman Dirge, but he only used him once, and he only said one sentence before he was shot down by a robot, so now all he's mine, ready for dangerous adventures.

I know this poem isn't proffesional, and not funny (well, some people think so) but I like it. I've written four parts. I'll post the next one later (the sequel is always crappier than the original, the rule of movies, now the rule of my poetry. Part three is OK.) called "The return of Mr. Happy Bunny

And therefore I must post it here! Haha!

Last Saturday as was at Raptus Bergen International Comics Festival 2004 :D and I met Lise, the creator of Nemi, and Roman Dirge, creator of Lenore and many other little horrific creatures.

It was so fun, I got up at 07:50 (on a saturday morning!) to get there before everyone else did, even though it didn't open before 11:00

I was on the second front row in Lise's seminar, and didn't have to queue long for getting my magazine signed (I had ordered the book two weeks before, but typically it hadn't arrived yet). I asked if I could have my picture taken with her, and se was like "yes, ofcourse! Come back here" so I went over to her and my friend took a picture :D

Here it is

Yes, naturally, I censored myself (too ugly for browser and viewers to handle)

Later, I found out that they sold Roman Dirge's stuff at a store there!

I was thrilled! I raced over to the store immediatly and bought Something at the Window is Scratching and Lenore - Noogies.

On my way out of the store, Don Rosa was having a signing. and hundreads of people were queued up, you really had to squeeze through to get from one place to another. So I did. As I "squeesed through" I thought how much I was looking forward to seeing Roman Dirge in own person and actually talking to him. It was pretty unreal imagining HIM speaking to ME while signing a book. Now, you will never guess which person I saw as I was squeezing through the crowd (No, it's not Mr.Rogers) - Roman Dirge! I reckodnised him at once, tattoos up his neck, down his hands, bigweird brown thingies in his ears - who else could it be? I've seen drawings of himself by himelf, and they're pretty life-like- So, I ran through the crowd, bumping into people and knocking some over, and went over to him. He stood there, alone, with no fans around him, only some guards and journalists, as if I was the only one who saw him. I held my nokia camera phone up close to him and took a picture (that didn't turn out that well) and then he saw me. I can't believe I said this, but I did: "I love you, you're my god!" and he was like "Oh, nice braclet!" and pointed at my long spiky bracelet thingie. I said "thank you!", and then I said "You make me laugh so much..." and he said "Oh, thanks!".

I went over to a chair to open my backpack and get out my digital camera so I could get a real picture, but when I turned around, he was gone.

The next 8 hours that day, my hands looked like I had parkinson. It even shows on some of my pictures, how much I've been shaking while taking them.

I went to a boring Tex Miller seminar (and nearly fell asleep) just so I could get a good seat for the next seminar - Roman Dirge's.           I got a good seat too - front row!

Afterwards he was signing stuff, and he signed my Something at the Window is Scratching book, and I asked if he could draw Mr.Gosh for me, and he was like "Yeah, sure!" I have it on the top of my bookshelf now :D along with the Nemi drawing.

I asked him one last question before I left: "What's your favourite way of killing Mr.Gosh?". He thought about it for a second or two, and then answered "Lawnmoer." Then everyone laughed. I said "Oh. I liked the 'plumbo in the tea' method". Then I asked "Are you gonna keep on killing him?" and he immediatly responded "YES! Definetley! He's in the next issue coming this year. Oh, well, he's not in it for long, cause Lenore kills him in the beginning."

I didn't ask how, cause I didn't want to spoil the suprise. But he probably wouldn't have spoiled it either.

All in all - that day was among the best one's in my life, and I'll never forget it!

By the way, here's the picture I took with him

Note: Don't forget the post below, where you can vote for your favourite manson album. I'm really curious how the vote is gonna turn out...

<h5>I'm curious...I know alot of people on LiveJournal who love Marilyn Manson.
I don't know which of their songs they like the most.<h5>

<h3>Let's have a vote for which of their albums is the best;<h3>

<h2>Portrait of an American Family
Antichrist Superstar
Mechanical Animals
Holy Wood (In the Shadow of the Valley of Death)
The Golden Age of Grotesque
Lest We Forget<h2>

<h5>I don't know if I should count Smells Like Children and Lest We Forget as albums.
But I listed Lest We Forget anyway.
I don't have a payed account, so you'll have to vote by commenting.
How long will the vote last before it's finished and I post the results?
Dunno...Let's say...10days.

<center>Starting with my vote...think...think...I guess it has to be Antichrist Superstar

<i>"Cut the head off
Grows back hard
I am the hydra
Now you've seen your star"<i><h5><center>

Take the quiz: "Think You Know Marilyn Manson?"

Yes
Yes! You know Marilyn Manson extremely well...you're not just a fan, you're an expert! Congratulations!

Ofcourse I know Marilyn Manson. He's my God. And a lot of the questions were based on his book, which I have read. Easy.

I never thought it would come to Norway the same day it came out in the US, but it did. It was probably released in the whole world on monday. I bought it today. I'm so happy, I can't believe I have it already. Finally, now I have all his videos. But on the CD, I really think it's missing some tracks. It hasn't got Antichrist Superstar on it, it hasn't got Dope Hat, nor Coma White, nor The Fight Song. But it has Personal Jesus (which I Personally think is not that good) and Tainted Love (which isn't even an original song by MM!)
Another thing : The DVD didn't contain the video clip Tainted Love. Wonder why...
I bought Army Boots two days ago :) I liked them, and they weren't too expensive either! In real leather! I got alot of different rections at school, like "They look weird..." and "why are you wearing army boots?" and this one guy first called me a hippie, then a nazi, then a faggot-satanist(?!??). Poor guy...born with mental problems and 20kg more fat on his body than everyone else has. He's not able to see things differently, that's probably why he hasn't got friends, though he thinks he has. I can't wait to start filming with my digital videocamera :D I love making movies (but I don't always like acting in them...) I've made a few before, with friends, and once I made one for a school project, adn the entire school watched it. It was a parody of The Ring, I called it "The Svamp" (svamp is norwegian and means spunge) it has no big meaning, but it's funny :) Okay, the post is big enough, if I make it any bigger no one will even care to read it (I know that from own experience). "Reach out and grab faith!"

<h4>I have so vivid dreams theese to last nights, usually, I don't even remeber my dreams, but theese were so disturbing I couldn't forget them!
Friday night the whole thing was just a movie playing before my eyes, I wasn't in it myself.
Saturday night (I just woke up) the dream was like a video game, I had objectives, I could die and start all over again, I could use items and move myself around. But the scary tihng was, I had first-person-view, and a 30meter tall monster running after me, killing all my friends, then me.<h4>

<h4>IF I decide to post my dreams (but they are really long and detailed, so I don't know if I will) I'll do that later today or maybe tomorrow. I might use the LJ cut tool thingie, if I work out how to...
Has anyone here used it before (help me, help me) :D:D:D<h4>

Industrial rock! Just like Marilyn Manson, you
know what you have to say and you just say it!
I like you very much...just be careful you
don't scare me away... YEAH!!! I knew I had to be something related to Marilyn Manson. They are the best. No-one beats Marilyn Manson!!!

care a lot about how your death will affect the

getting out of the pain that consumes you. All

oOo...isn't that interesting? This is my third post today...better stop now.

<h4>I'm fifteen...weey...<h4>

<h4>I have 9 books I have to read.
They are following:<h4>   
<h5>1.Discover and develop Your Sixth Sense - Julie Soskin
2.Paradise Lost - John Milton
3.Around the World in Eighty Days - Jules Verne (wanna read the book before I see the movie) 
4.The Complete works of Edgar Allan Poe - Edgar Allan Poe
5.Astral Dynamics - Robert Bruce
6.Satans Kvinnfolk ("Satan's Women") - Hege Duckert
7.The Cat with a really big head, and another story that isn't as good - Roman Dirge
8.Hypnosis for beginners - William Hewitt
9.Heksenes Forsvarere, en historisk reportasje ("The Withces defendors, a historical documentary") - Jan Guillou<h5>

<h4>I already started reading the astral dynamics books and the hypnosis book and the sixth sense book and Paradise Lost I'm at page 66 AND I'm nearly done with, and I've started the Roman Dirge book (real fun!) and I read some Poe. And some of the witch book. The astral dynamics books has 560pages, and the Poe books has over a thousand!
This is hopeless...I'll have to cancel some and/or delay some.<h4>

<h4>Speaking of books, Mansons book is a fantastic piece of art. It is also the most interesting book I have ever read.
Paradise Lost is turning out too be extremely interesting too. Infact, I had never heard of it before Manson mentioned it in his own book. It got my attention. Later, I bought it :D It's great, it's about Satans failed rebellion against God, and how he fell from Heaven but later succeeded in perverting mankind. Though it is 350 years old and hard to understand, I highly recommend it.<h4>

Has anyone read The Raven (By Poe) ? I read it twice, it's so good! I saw the "The Simpsons Halloween Special" version of it too. Twice :) I liked it. I've watched hundreds of simpsons episodes, I have like...*thinking*...eight VHS's and alot of recorded like 15 recorded VHS's at my Dads place.
The Simpsons rock.

I like ice-tea! I don't like going to christian summer camps for a week where people sing Praise the Lord, and I love you Jesus! I went there just so I could get confirmated, and maybe meet some new friends. The bus trip was hell....10hours each way...oh joy... There were some Nightwish fans there and some Dimmu Borgir and Slipknot fans there too. I might post some pics later. But one thing that really scared was this: Tuesday, I saw a guy with a Slipknot t-shirt. "Cool" I thought. The next day (you won't believe this, I still don't myself!) he wore....*whimper*....he wore.......HE WORE A BRITNEY T-SHIRT! YES! IT'S TRUE! I can't get over it....he had to be kidding...but...you know...that's stuff you just dont mess with. You don't mess with people's minds. I think I'm going even more crazy. God bless me... There is a God out there somewhere, but I don't believe it's the one the Christians are talking about. They've got the wrong picture. Well, that's only my opinion. Go in peace :P haha
